name: Hardest Blending Fact and Fiction Trivia Quiz | TV & Movies Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Irving Stone is one of the best known writers of the "historical novel". Who is the subject of his book, "The Agony and the Ecstasy"?
questions.explanation:
Michelangelo.

	Tortured Michelangelo - as played by Charlton Heston.

questions.text: Who is the subject of Stone's "Lust for Life"?
questions.explanation:
Vincent Van Gogh.

	Kirk Douglas as Van Gogh; Anthony Quinn as his friend, Gauguin.

questions.text: Who is being described in "A Dead Man in Deptford" ?
questions.explanation:
Christopher Marlowe.

	Marlowe's death in Deptford (England) is quite curious; this novel considers some possibile explanations.

questions.text: Who is the author of "Dead Man in Deptford"?
questions.explanation:
Anthony Burgess.

	Burgess (of "Clockwork Orange" fame) is the author.

questions.text: Irving Stone once more: Who did he write about in "The Passions of the Mind"?
questions.explanation:
Sigmund Freud.

	This one was about Sigmund the great.

questions.text: "The Valley of the Dolls" was a novel (and later a movie) that was said to be based on actual people. Who was the author?
questions.explanation:
Jacqueline Susann.

	Susann, considered by some to be the "queen of trash" is the author.

questions.text: Which of the following is said to be one of the people being depicted in "Valley of the Dolls"?
questions.explanation:
Judy Garland.

	Barbara Parkins, Sharon Tate, Patty Duke and Susan Hayward in the cast. One character, the pill-popper, is said to be based on Garland.

questions.text: Errol Flynn starred in "The Sea Hawk". Who is being loosely described in the story?
questions.explanation:
Francis Drake.

	The great Elizabethan explorer, sailor-solider and adventurer.

questions.text: "Citizen  Kane" is considered to be the masterpiece work of Orson Welles. Who is supposedly being described?
questions.explanation:
William Randolph Hearst.

	The fictional Kane was said to be inspired by Hearst.

questions.text: "Dominique" was a big hit for "The Singing Nun". Who played her in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Debbie Reynolds.

	In and out of the convent (as well as her singing career), she struggled for a while.
